comment: says "time isn't real" and really a pop sciency teacher. for ap phys c she doesn't teach. tests we go into them without any knowledge and she forces us to do boring labs which don't even make sense. her assignments she assigns are more sloppily formatted than what you're reading right now.

Dr. Beyer is the most amazing lab professor ever! I was initially hesitant to take her course after seeing such a deceptive review about her, but she is the best. Lab was super easy, no question is a dumb question to her, she is always helpful. Take her course and get an easy A+; it is impossible to get a B as long as you follow the directions!

The nicest professor I have ever had. Very respectful and never shut the door, students would come in like 30 minutes before class ended and would still have the opportunity to earn a 100 on the lab. She took the time to explain something if you were confused and if something was not adding up with your work, she would stay and help solve it.

She may seem blunt at first, but in actuality, she's a super understanding and relaxed professor. All groups consistently got high scores on each lab, and she gave insight that made the labs easier. Idk what some of the other reviews are on abt because she had zero attitude.

lucky to have her in high school and had the chance to take her at ksu too but she is not for everyone. very knowledgeable lecturer and knows what she is talking about. ask lots of questions and you'll be fine. very easy grader as well but the class takes a lot of effort as well. gl

I personally think She's great. people may dislike what I say, but at the end of the day, you want to end up with an A in this class. I swear to God, you're not going to be dealing with 80% of what they teach you in college in real life. So she's good; don't argue with her, ask her questions, work with a smart group, and move on with your life. gl
yikes. I've never seen a professor act the way she does. She grades relatively decent, but I would just hold back on asking any questions. wouldnt take her if you actually wanna understand

Prof. Beyer often degraded the students in our lab class, making us feel inferior due to her having "multiple physics degrees". At least half of the tables got up and left because we could not handle being talked down to so much. She often states not to follow the directions in the lab manual but rarely answers questions for clarification. AVOID!!
